oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Theoretical investigation of intramolecular magnetic interaction through an ethylenic coupler
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: VYAS, S
ALI, ME
HOSSAIN, E
PATWARDHAN, S
DATTA, SN
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: nitrophenyl nitronyl nitroxide
transition-metal complexes
binuclear complexes
ab-initio
exchange interactions
dft calculations
beta-phase
diradicals
biradicals
radicals
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We show that an ethylenic coupler provides a very strong intramolecular magnetic interaction. A recently synthesized nitronyl nitroxide derivative, D-NIT2, is investigated by ab initio quantum chemical methods. The broken symmetry approach yields a coupling constant -541 K that is in good agreement with the observed value in solid state.
